title: Plinth Coffee Table
description:
With the Plinth Coffee Table (2017), Norm Architects wanted to rethink the centuries-old idea of a podium and celebrate the natural beauty of marble. Expert stone masters carefully select marble with the best composition and veining for Plinth Tables – each of which has unique markings that make it one of a kind. The result is a collection with multiple uses in the home, office, or showroom. These tables are hollow to make them easier to move but, due to the thickness of the marble, they’re still satisfyingly hefty, weighing in at 200 pounds for the Standard Coffee Table and 324 pounds for the XL Coffee Table. Made in China, Portugal, or Slovenia, depending on type of stone.
  • Sleek tables celebrate the natural beauty of marble.
  • Carrara, Grey Galaxy, Kunis, Nero Marquina or Rose marble.
  • Tables are hollow to make them easier to move.
  • Standard Coffee Table weighs 200 pounds, XL Coffee Table weighs 324 pounds.
  • Marble is a natural material and the marbling patterns on each table will vary.
Brand
Audo Copenhagen
Collection
Plinth Table Collection
General Dimensions
  • 11" H 54" W 30" D
Product Weight
366.5 lbs
Assembly
Comes fully assembled

title: Platner Coffee Table
description:
Warren Platner worked with design giants I.M. Pei and Eero Saarinen before developing his Platner Collection (1966), which reflects his belief that there’s room in modernism “for the kind of decorative, gentle, graceful design that appeared in a period style like Louis XV.” This airy steel wire collection, for which he devised the structure and production method, requires as many as 1,000 welds per piece to create. Made in Italy.
  • Airy steel wire rod construction.
  • Tempered glass, solid marble, or wood veneer top.
  • Plastic ring for protecting floors.
  • Greenguard Indoor Air Quality Certified for low-emitting products.
Brand
Knoll®
Collection
Platner Collection
General Dimensions
  • 15¼" H 36" DIA
Product Weight
96 lbs
Assembly
Requires Assembly
Warranty
5-year warranty
Terms and conditions apply. Learn more

title: Saarinen Coffee Table, Oval
description:
Architect Eero Saarinen was a genius at creating expressive sculptural forms. From his TWA Terminal (now the TWA Hotel) at New York’s JFK Airport to the Gateway Arch in St. Louis to his Pedestal Table (1956), there’s a magic in everything he created. The Saarinen Table began with his observation that “the underside of typical tables and chairs makes a confusing, unrestful world,” and as he explained in a 1956 Time magazine cover story, he was designing a new collection to “clear up the slum of legs in the U.S. home.” Later that year, he completed the Pedestal Table, which stands on a gracefully shaped cast-aluminum base inspired by a drop of high-viscosity liquid. This is the authentic Pedestal Table by Knoll; it’s stamped with the KnollStudio logo and Eero Saarinen’s signature. Tabletop made in Italy or U.S.A., depending on material.

Stone masters carefully select marble with the best composition and veining to create tops for marble Saarinen Pedestal Tables. Please rest assured that each one’s unique markings are not imperfections but rather the very traits that make it a true one of a kind.

Polished Marble tops have a glossy polyester coating, and Satin Marble tops have a matte satin polyester coating; both types help protect against stains.
  • This is an authentic Knoll Saarinen Table.
  • Sturdy, cast-aluminum base.
  • Solid marble, wood veneer or laminate top.
  • Distinct sculptural base inspired by a drop of liquid.
  • A timeless modern classic in continuous production since 1956.
Eco-Friendly Description: Certified Intertek Clean Air GOLD. Products certified Intertek Clean Air GOLD are certified for low-VOC emissions and conform to ANSI/ BIFMA e3 standard credits 7.6.1, 7.6.2 and/or credit 7.6.3, which includes California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 01350 (2017), as well as conformance to low-emitting materials for WELL and LEED.

Knoll®
Collection

title: Yoko Coffee Table
description:
“My design for this table started with the oversize ball feet,” says Australian designer Sarah Ellison of this DWR-exclusive table. “We crave that human element that is round and soft, and sensual in a way.” The Yoko Coffee Table (2022) takes inspiration from Japanese minimalism but with contemporary proportions and functionality. Choose from a square or oval size in a walnut or oak finish. Made in Vietnam.
  • Modern coffee table with oversize spherical feet.
  • Playful juxtaposition of straight and round forms.
Brand
ELLISON STUDIOS
General Dimensions
  • 11⅞" H 59⅛" W 33½" D

title: Nelson Platform Bench
description:
For Herman Miller's influential design director George Nelson, utility was as important as beauty. Originally designed for his own office, where Nelson hoped the slatted top would discourage visitors from sitting too long, the Platform Bench (1946) is both timeless and functional. Available with finger-jointed wood base or slender chromed metal legs for superior strength. This is the authentic Nelson Bench produced by Herman Miller.
  • Solid wood construction with an airy slatted top.
  • Authentic modern bench designed by George Nelson.
  • Serves equally well as bench or table.

Herman Miller
Collection
Nelson Bench Collection

title: Eames Rectangular Coffee Table
description:
Charles and Ray Eames began experimenting with molded wood in the early 1940s, pressing thin sheets of veneer against a heated membrane – their Kazam! Machine – to perfect their signature molded plywood shaping technology. The Eames Rectangular Coffee Table (1946), with gently curved legs, derives from that technology and shows a commitment to honest materials and techniques. This is an authentic Eames product by Herman Miller. Eames is a licensed trademark of Herman Miller.
  • By legendary husband-and-wife design team.
  • Derived from signature plywood-molding technology.
  • Range of top and base options.

Herman Miller
General Dimensions

title: Cyclade Table
description:
Inspired by the idea of shifting islands that can come together or float apart, Cyclade (2023) is a versatile collection of sculptural nesting tables designed to enhance your living space. Sold individually, the three tables are unique in height, material (with wood, stone, or marble tops) and form, allowing them to nest and intersect in myriad configurations. The notched openings further the creative possibilities: Add plants or a table lamp; or let a section of rug peek through. Cyclade was designed by Gabriel Tan for Herman Miller.
  • Sculptural occasional tables with wood, stone, or marble tops.
  • Three heights and shapes to suit a variety of uses.
  • Nest and overlap the tables to create unique arrangements.
  • Notched openings create interesting negative spaces and pass-throughs.
Brand
Herman Miller
Collection
Cyclade Collection
General Dimensions
  • 15⅞" H 26½" W 15½" D
Product Weight

Assembly

title: Girard Flower Table
description:
A testament to Alexander Girard's mastery of organic form, the Girard Flower Table (1977) brings artistic elegance to any space. The distinctive design features a petal-shaped base and scalloped tabletop for a graceful study in visual harmony. Offered in two sizes, this versatile surface works beautifully indoors and out, embodying the perfect mix of playful design and practical function.
  • Original Alexander Girard design.
  • Powder-coated steel construction thrives inside and outdoors.
  • Offered in two sizes.
Brand
Herman Miller
General Dimensions
  • 9¾" H 23½" DIA
Product Weight
23 lbs
